titleStmt.title: ཡེ་ཤེས་སྙིང་པོ་ཀུན་ལས་བཏུས་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི་བཤད་སྦྱར།
ye shes snying po kun las btus pa zhes bya ba'i bshad sbyar/
Jñāna­sāra­samuccaya­nāma­nibandhana
Explanations Connected to “The Compendium of the Essence of Exalted Wisdom”

bibl.author: Bodhibhadra
Jetahandu Śāntibhadra
lo tsa ba dge slong chos kyi shes rab

notesStmt.note: Last updated at 07/09/2018 at 10:24:48 by admin

The term nibandhana (bshad sbyar) in this context, appears to refer to a very specific style of commentary, in which descriptive summaries of passages in a root text are provided with only minimal reference to the source (e.g. “Then one verse indicates the difficulties of realizing that”; de nas tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis de rtogs par dka' ba bstan to). The best way to render the term nibandhana (bshad sbyar) in English is unclear, although the contents of the text would seems to suggest rendering the title as "A Skeleton Key to 'The Compendium of the Essence of Exalted Wisdom'.”
